message.content:
cs.AR, cs.PF, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE

This paper discusses the performance benefit of hybrid memory systems on HPC environments, which is a topic related to computer architecture (cs.AR) and performance evaluation (cs.PF). The paper also analyzes the impact of memory access patterns on application performance, which falls under the category of data-centric computing (cs.DC) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the use of hardware threads to improve performance, which is related to software engineering (cs.SE).
